titleStmt.title: Land cadastre of the Pondicherry area

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This document appears to be a land cadastre/register. It pertains to the Pondicherry area and three territorial divisions (tālūkkā) thereof: the Putuccēri-t-tālūkkā (Pondicherry), the Villavanallūr-tālūkkā (actual Villianour/Villiyaṉūr), and the Pākūr-tālūkkā (Bahour).

For each tālūkkā, is first provided a list of ayaṉkiṟāmams (Government land) and associated matuṟākiṟāmams (sweet land, that is, land free from saline impregnation [see Wilson 1855, p. 315, s.v. Madhu, on the term madhurī, as used in Cuttack region] or toddy land [see MTL, s.v. maturai, "spirituous liquor"]?). The matuṟākiṟāmams are either named or given the status of {puṉcey} (land fit for dry cultivation only). For each tālūkkā, an individual total is given, making the distinction between amāṉi ayaṉkiṟāmams (government managed land) and koṅceciyakiṟāmams (leased land, from French “concession”?). Finally (f10v, c9–10) an overall total is given for the three tālūkkās making the distinction between ayaṉkiṟāmam (that is, amāṉi ayaṉkiṟāmam) and koṅceciyakiṟāmam.
It seems that the abbreviation {poṉ} ("gold") is used in the left margin in the same function as the piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, which is sometimes used instead.

title.term: Land cadastre of the Pondicherry area

collation.desc: 10 folios. Tamil foliation 1-10 ({mutal} for folio 1, then 2‒10). This foliation is, unusually, found below the single hole on each recto folio. Another numbering is found in the margin, individualised per division (tālūkkā), starting with the second folio pertaining to the concerned division.

layoutDesc.layout: The lay-out of the pages is in columns (approximately 10 columns per page).

binding.p: Mahogany woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique (BnF gift no. 1192).

provenance.p: Owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).
